instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1932 820-01512-A that has 20.5V (steady), but gets to 0.20A and cycles in arround 10 senconds

PPBUS_G3H oscillates in between 12.60V and 12.28V

P5VG3S_VSW oscillates in between 5.124V and 0V
PP5V_G3S oscillates in between 5.124V and 0V

PP3V3_G3H steady 3.3V
P3V3G3H_VSW  oscillates in between 3.3V and 3.5V

PP1v2_S0SW  = 0V
PP1v_S0SW  = 0V

ALL_SYSPWRGD = 0V

No signs of corrosion, and no short on any big coil.

Have no idea where to go from here.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
It is recognized into DFU mode?

Inspect audio board/flex for corrosion.

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

It isen't recognized in DFU mode, and I have the same result with the board alone on the bench

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on U7800 coils.
Also check all big coils.
Compare readings with good board.

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message: I don't know if this error helps, but when I try to do the DFU, I always get the error "connect this mac to a thuntherbolt port"

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message: Did you try with the same cable used for other DFU jobs?

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message: Yes. I've tried with 2 original cables, used before in DFU

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message: T2's AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are stable?

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Not sure if are these ones. If they aren't, can you specifidy them please?

PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.2V
PP1V8_AWAKE = 1.799V
PP3V3_AWAKE = 3.3V

SOC_AWAKE_BLUE = 0V
SOC_AWAKE_BLUE_R = 0V

SOC_SLPS2R_RED = 0V
SOC_SLPS2R_RED_R = 0V

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi

L7811 = 0.837V and 0.161on diode to ground reading
L7813 = 0V and 0.356 on diode to ground reading
L7814 = 1.1V and 0.269 on diode to ground reading

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message: Change U7800...

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
I don't have any donor board for it.

Do you know if I can find it in another board model?

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
Replacing U7800 worked.
TKS.

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message: DFU restore?

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Yes, DFU restore finished without errors.

Connecting with eth cable worked, and I manage to install macOS.

TKS!

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

It seams that I have other problem on this one:

When I close the display, the Mac don't hibernate.

I think that probably there is some sensor to activate it, but don't know what it is.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Check SMC_LID_LEFT/RIGHT signals.
At least one should drop when close the lid.
IPD_LID_OPEN should drop at same time.

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

SMC_LID_LEFT is 0V, but  IPD_LID_OPEN  remains at 1.8V (read at J6700 with cable disconected)
SMC_LID_RIGHT is 1.8V

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
U4802 is an "OR" gate, so both inputs must drop to 0V, in order to drop output too.
You have a problem with right lid sensor.

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
Any idea on how I can solve this?
I can´t find the LID sensor

I have no clue...

threads.title: A1932 820-01512-A no power
threads.message:
You're right. It worked.
TKS!
